item.title: 德国仿人机器人首次亮相失败
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日通讯。今天，维雷娜-塞普（Verena Sepp）和马克-伯根（Mark Bergen）将从慕尼黑一场失败的机器人演示中发回消息。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Verena Sepp and Mark Bergen send a dispatch from a botched robotics demonstration in Munich.】

item.title: 美国遭受 "双重打击"，春季房地产市场一片萧条
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂，波士顿的经济编辑。今天我们将关注美国房地产市场的低迷状况。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at the dour state of the US housing market. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 日本与美国的贸易谈判因汽车关税问题陷入僵局
item.description: 现在似乎是一个提醒的好时机，在贸易格斗俱乐部中，有几条规则。【原文：Now seems like a good time for a reminder that in trade fight club, there are a couple of rules.】

item.title: Jes Staley 因与爱泼斯坦的关系被禁赛，最终败诉
item.description: 前巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）老板杰斯-斯塔利（Jes Staley）因与杰弗里-爱泼斯坦（Jeffrey Epstein）的关系而被城市监管机构禁入，他在推翻禁入令的法律诉讼中败诉，这几乎断送了他在英国金融服务业恢复名誉的努力。【原文：Former Barclays Plc boss Jes Staley lost a legal battle to overturn his ban from the City watchdog over his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein, all but ending his attempt to rehabilitate himself in the British financial services industry.】

item.title: 俄罗斯北极液化天然气 2 号附近数月来首次出现油轮
item.description: 一艘液化天然气油轮似乎正驶向被美国制裁的俄罗斯北极出口工厂，这可能是莫斯科为恢复闲置八个月之久的工厂运输所做的最新努力。【原文：A liquefied natural gas tanker appears to be heading to a Russian Arctic export plant sanctioned by the US, potentially Moscow’s latest efforts to revive shipments from a facility idled for eight months.】

item.title: 贸易战担忧消退，动物精神重回亚洲
item.description:
从股票、货币到信贷，四月市场动荡后的反弹令人印象深刻

。【原文：

From stocks to currencies to credit, the rebound from the depths of the April market turmoil has been impressive

】

item.title: 太阳能制造商 Meyer Burger 的美国子公司申请破产
item.description: Meyer Burger Technology AG 的美国业务已申请破产保护程序，目的是出售这家总部位于瑞士的太阳能制造商在美国的全部或大部分资产。【原文：Meyer Burger Technology AG’s US operations have filed for Chapter 11 proceedings with the aim of selling all or most of the Swiss-headquartered solar manufacturer’s assets in the country.】

item.title: 中国在美国紧张局势下试探性进口阿根廷豆粕
item.description: 中国罕见地从阿根廷预订了一批豆粕，因为在与美国的贸易战持续不断的情况下，中国正努力确保一种关键动物饲料原料的供应。【原文：China has booked a rare shipment of soybean meal from Argentina, as the country seeks to secure supplies of a key animal feed ingredient amid an ongoing trade war with the US.】

item.title: PayPal 支持的 Pine Labs 借助金融科技热潮提交印度 IPO 申请
item.description: 数字支付提供商 Pine Labs Ltd. 已在印度申请首次公开募股，政府的数字化推动促进了金融技术领域的蓬勃发展。【原文：Digital payments provider Pine Labs Ltd. filed for an initial public offering in India, as the government’s digitization push fuels a boom in the financial technology space.】

item.title: 伊朗导弹袭击以色列造成 30 亿美元损失
item.description: 以色列估计，在与伊朗的 12 天战争中造成的损失高达 100 亿谢克尔（约合 30 亿美元），所需资金既用于修复被导弹击中的建筑物，也用于向当地企业支付赔偿金。【原文：Israel has estimated the cost of damages incurred during its 12-day war with Iran at 10 billion shekels ($3 billion), with funds needed both to repair missile-hit buildings and pay compensation to local businesses.】

item.title: Palantir 空头出逃，S&P500 强股票继续攀升
item.description: 在狂热的散户交易者和地缘政治紧张局势加剧的助推下，Palantir Technologies Inc.【原文：Investors betting against Palantir Technologies Inc. are throwing in the towel as the software maker’s shares keep pushing higher, aided by fervent retail traders and heightened geopolitical tensions.】

item.title: 立陶宛呼吁欧盟为东部边境安全提供资金支持
item.description: 立陶宛总统吉塔纳斯-纳塞达（Gitanas Nauseda）呼吁欧盟在国家预算紧张的情况下帮助资助集团东部边界的加固工作。【原文：Lithuanian President Gitanas Nauseda called on the European Union to help finance the fortification of the bloc’s eastern borders as the expenses strain national budgets.】

item.title: 美国银行股复苏取决于规则放宽和交易复苏
item.description: 监管放松、交易不断、利率上升：这是美国银行股股价走高的秘诀。【原文：Loosening regulations, the steady drumbeat of dealmaking, elevated interest rates: It’s a recipe for US banking stocks shares to rip higher.】

item.title: 新闻 24 频道称南非总统正在权衡内阁人事变动
item.description: 南非总统西里尔-拉马福萨（Cyril Ramaphosa）正在权衡对其内阁进行调整，其中包括免去身为执政联盟第二大党成员的国家贸易部副部长的职务。【原文：South African President Cyril Ramaphosa is weighing changes to his cabinet, including removing the nation’s deputy trade minister who’s a member of the second-largest party in the ruling coalition.】

item.title: 伊拉克称美国公司是计划首次进口液化天然气的竞标者之一
item.description: 伊拉克正在与 Excelerate Energy Inc. 进行深入谈判，以促进该国首次进口液化天然气，因为这个饱受停电之苦的国家正在寻求减少对伊朗的供应依赖。【原文：Iraq is in advanced talks with Excelerate Energy Inc. to facilitate its first-ever liquefied natural gas imports as the country, which struggles with power outages, seeks to cut dependence on Iran for supplies.】

item.title: 活力如何成为几乎不败的经济指标
item.description:
密歇根大学的 Joanne Hsu 可以看出美国家庭的情绪很低落。有人在听吗？【原文：

University of Michigan’s Joanne Hsu can tell US households are in a foul mood. Is anyone listening?

】

item.title: 韩国将宣布降低房价的措施，韩联社
item.description: 韩联社周四援引未具名消息人士的话报道称，韩国计划在下月初宣布稳定房价的措施，包括收紧首尔周边过热地区的贷款和税收法规。【原文：South Korea plans to announce measures to stabilize spiraling house prices early next month, including tightening lending and tax regulations for overheated areas around Seoul, Yonhap News reported Thursday, citing unnamed sources.】

item.title: S&P 500 图表观察家担心反弹的领导排名狭窄
item.description: 随着科技股推动美国主要股指屡创新高，技术分析师认为，除非有更多板块加入涨势，否则未来几个月将出现抛售。【原文：With technology stocks powering major US indexes toward record highs, technical analysts see the makings of a selloff in the coming months unless more sectors join the rally.】

item.title: 希尔豪斯支持的印度初创企业创始人利用私人信贷
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印度工作空间初创公司 Table Space 的一位创始人从私人信贷基金筹集了约 20 亿卢比（约合 2330 万美元）的资金，用于在该公司计划首次公开募股之前购买其股份。【原文：A founder of Indian workspace startup Table Space raised about 2 billion rupees ($23.3 million) from private credit funds to finance the purchase of a stake in the company ahead of its planned initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 泰国大麻产业陷入混乱，政府欲将大麻重新定罪
item.description: 泰国在成为亚洲第一个将大麻非刑罪化的国家三年后，准备在政治动荡中改变方向，现在需要有处方才能在 2022 年以来兴起的 10,000 家药房中的任何一家购买大麻。【原文：Three years after becoming the first Asian nation to decriminalize cannabis, Thailand is poised to reverse course amid political turmoil and now requires a prescription to buy cannabis at any of the 10,000 dispensaries that have sprung up since 2022.】

item.title: Thungela 表示，随着安全状况改善，Transnet 煤炭装运量上升
item.description: 据 Thungela Resources Ltd. 称，在解决了运营和安全相关问题后，南非国营物流公司已在该国主要出口铁路线上加大了煤炭交付力度。【原文：South Africa’s state logistics company has ramped up deliveries of coal on the country’s main export rail line after addressing operational and security-related issues, according to Thungela Resources Ltd.】

item.title: 加拿大青年就业市场在主要经济体中下滑幅度最大
item.description: 加拿大年轻人面临的劳动力市场恶化速度比任何其他主要发达经济体都要快。【原文：Young Canadians are facing a labor market that has deteriorated faster than in any other major advanced economy.】

item.title: 投资者摆脱贸易焦虑，亚洲市场全面活跃
item.description: 随着亚洲摆脱关税冲击，并以稳健的增长前景吸引投资者，亚洲各地的交易台再次热闹起来。【原文：Trading desks across Asia are buzzing with excitement again, as the region shakes off tariff shocks and attracts investors with its solid growth prospects.】

item.title: BBVA 在德国开办数字零售银行以促进增长
item.description: 随着西班牙银行在更多欧洲市场推出数字零售银行，BBVA SA 在德国向客户开放了数字零售银行。【原文：BBVA SA has opened its digital retail bank to customers in Germany as the Spanish lender rolls out its offering across more European markets.】

item.title: 克瓦查反弹推动赞比亚通胀率降至 14 个月低点
item.description: 在赞比亚货币反弹帮助抑制了进口成本之后，赞比亚的年度通货膨胀率在 6 月份降至 14 个月以来的最低点。【原文：Zambia’s annual inflation eased to a 14-month low in June after a rally in its currency helped curb the cost of imports.】

item.title: 为什么制造可靠的自动驾驶汽车如此困难？
item.description: 二十年前，美国军方在其具有开创意义的 Darpa 挑战赛中，派出一支刚刚起步的机器人车队穿越莫哈韦沙漠，拉开了制造自动驾驶汽车竞赛的序幕。到 2015 年，自动驾驶汽车技术得到广泛应用，业界盛传无人驾驶汽车很快将无处不在。【原文：Two decades ago, the US military kicked off the race to build self-driving cars by sending a fleet of fledgling robot vehicles across the Mojave Desert in its seminal Darpa challenge. By 2015, autonomous vehicle technology was being widely pursued, and the industry was abuzz with predictions that driverless cars would soon be everywhere.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚利用网上市场促进税收征管
item.description: 随着东南亚最大经济体对财政问题的日益关注，印尼将修改一项规则，要求网商向电子商务平台而不是直接向政府缴纳所得税，从而重振促进税收的努力。【原文：A rule change in Indonesia will require online merchants to pay income tax to e-commerce platforms rather than directly to the government, reviving an effort to boost tax collection as fiscal concerns mount in Southeast Asia’s largest economy.】

item.title: 南非消费者信心在第二季度有所恢复
item.description: 由于取消了增加消费税的提议，联合政府在预算问题上的僵局也告一段落，南非消费者的信心在第二季度有所恢复。【原文：South African consumer confidence recovered in the second quarter as a proposed increase in consumer taxes was scrapped and an impasse in the coalition government over the budget ended.】

item.title: Hg 支持的软件公司 Visma 据称将选择在伦敦上市
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，由 Hg Capital 支持的 Visma 公司已暂时选择在伦敦进行首次公开募股，这为该公司在一个难以吸引大型公司上市的股票市场上大张旗鼓地进行科技股上市创造了条件。【原文：Hg Capital-backed Visma has provisionally chosen London for an initial public offering, according to a person familiar with the matter, setting the stage for a blockbuster tech listing in a stock market that has struggled to attract major debuts.】

item.title: 希望恢复超音速喷气式飞机旅行的公司
item.description:
协和式飞机失败的地方，Boom 能否成功？【原文：

Can Boom succeed where the Concorde failed?

】
